title: Aluminum - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Aluminum fell to 2877 USD/T on December 12, 2025, down 0.92% from the previous day, though it remains 10.02% higher than a year ago. UK aluminum futures rose toward $2,880 per tonne near the one-month high, supported by improving demand prospects, tight global supply, and China's stimulus measures against its property crisis.

title: Aluminum Hovers Near 1-Month High
summary: Aluminum increased to 2917.00 USD/T, the highest since November 2025, with a 1.35% gain over the past 4 weeks. UK futures hovered near the one-month high due to improving demand, tight supply from China's production cap, setbacks in Indonesian smelters, and disruptions like the Iceland smelter suspension; prices have risen nearly 14% this year.

title: Alcoa says high US aluminum prices offset Trump tariff costs
summary: Alcoa reported $69 million in additional US tariff costs on Canadian aluminum, offset by higher domestic prices including a 113% jump in the US Midwest premium since early June. The company expects further $50 million in tariff costs this quarter amid declining inventory and imports, with normal shipments resuming.

title: Electricity Scarcity Meets Aluminum Tariffs, and American Citizens Pick Up the Bill
summary: US Midwest aluminum premium surged to $1,300-$1,900 per ton after 2025 tariff escalations, 2.5-4 times higher than the prior $450-$550 range, driven by policy amid electricity constraints and import dependence. This diverges sharply from global LME prices, raising costs for US buyers and complicating new smelter investments due to higher WACC from policy volatility.

title: Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Steel prices fell to 3045 CNY/T on December 12, 2025, down 0.03% from the previous day, amid ongoing demand uncertainties in China. Steel rebar futures dropped toward CNY 3,040 per ton, reaching monthly lows, despite Beijing's reaffirmation of broad economic support measures. Over the past month, prices have declined 0.10%, and are down 7.36% year-over-year.

title: CRU: Data center demand drives US rebar toward June 2023 highs
summary: US rebar prices rose in early December due to strong data center demand, approaching $1,000/metric ton, the highest since June 2023, supported by fewer imports and extended mill lead times. Structurals prices also increased amid supply tightness, while wire rod remained flat as end-use consumption lagged. Infrastructure activity around AI data centers boosted demand, though sustainability is questioned.

title: Global Iron and Steel Prices and News 14.12.2025
summary: SteelRadar provides real-time updates on global iron and steel exchanges, including Shanghai Futures rebar prices as of December 12, 2025, showing no change at 0.00%. The platform covers indices, prices, and news for various futures terms across regions like China, Turkey, Europe, and North America. Latest sections include rebar news, scrap news, and iron and steel markets.

title: US Steel to resume production at Illinois plant shut 3 years ago
summary: U.S. Steel plans to resume steel slab production at its Granite City Works plant in Illinois, idled since 2023, due to strengthening demand. The company will reopen a blast furnace in the first half of 2026 after hiring 400 workers and preparing equipment. This follows a national security agreement with Nippon Steel, which includes $14 billion in U.S. steel investments.

title: U.S. Steel to restart steel production at Illinois plant
summary: U.S. Steel is restarting a blast furnace at its Granite City Works in Illinois after analyzing customer demand, aiming for production in early 2026. The move requires hiring 400 of 500 needed workers amid a robust U.S. steel market boosted by tariffs and rising shipments. It aligns with commitments under the Nippon Steel acquisition for domestic production investments.

title: Semiconductors, Displays 'Clear'; Petrochemicals, Steel 'Cloudy'
summary: South Korea's steel industry faces 'cloudy' prospects in 2026 due to Chinese oversupply and U.S./EU import restrictions, with exports expected to drop 2.1%. The Korea Iron and Steel Association notes declining shipments to traditional markets despite gains in emerging ones like Latin America. This contrasts with 'clear' outlooks for semiconductors and displays.

title: Green Steelmaking Innovation: Tech & Climate Impact 2025
summary: An overview of hydrogen‑based 'green steel' technologies and their potential to reduce steelmaking emissions by 85–95%, highlighting initiatives such as HYBRIT and the policy, investment and supply‑chain drivers needed for industrial scale deployment.

title: Tata Steel & constructsteel Launches Climate-Resilient Zero Energy Building
summary: Report on Tata Steel and constructsteel unveiling India’s first steel‑based Zero Energy Building (ZEB), a 1,836 sq. ft. facility built using light gauge steel framing (LGSF) that combines high insulation, rooftop solar/BIPV and water‑saving features to achieve net‑zero annual energy use and showcase low‑carbon construction with steel.

title: Facilitating the energy transition with low-CO2 steel
summary: Profile of Blastr Green Steel describing its integrated approach to produce 'ultra‑low‑CO2' steel (targeting ~90% reduction vs conventional routes) through direct reduction pellet feedstock and decarbonised value chains, and discussion of scaling impacts compared to national transport emissions.

title: Breakthrough Technology Conference 2025 — event page
summary: Event page for worldsteel’s Breakthrough Technology Conference 2025 in Singapore, summarising the conference focus on technology options to decarbonise the steel industry and providing access to presentation materials and regional member updates.

title: Experts urge factories to produce 100% refined steel to cut carbon emissions
summary: Coverage of expert recommendations for the steel sector to shift to refined steel production, adopt renewable energy and electric‑arc furnace routes to improve environmental performance and reduce carbon emissions in national steel industries.

title: Comex Copper Settles 2.87% Higher at $5.4270 — Data Talk
summary: Front Month Comex Copper for December delivery gained 15.15 cents per pound, or 2.87%, settling at $5.4270, marking the largest one-day dollar gain since October 13, 2025. This represents the highest settlement since July 30, 2025, and is up 36.15% year-to-date. The price is off 6.35% from its 52-week high of $5.795.

title: Copper - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Copper fell to 5.28 USD/Lbs on December 12, 2025, down 2.45% from the previous day, retreating from multi-month highs around $5.40 per pound. The decline reflects demand uncertainties from China despite signals of boosting domestic demand in 2026. Over the past month, prices have risen 4.66%, and year-over-year up 27.38%.

title: Copper gives up record highs near $12,000 at the London Exchange
summary: Three-month copper futures on the LME fell 0.35% to $11,829 per ton after touching an all-time high of $11,952, amid concerns that elevated prices could weigh on demand. The metal remains on track for weekly gains for the third consecutive week. In contrast, Shanghai Futures Exchange copper closed up 1.95% at 94.08 thousand yuan per ton.

title: Commodities market: Copper prices surge 35% this year
summary: Copper prices are soaring towards $12,000 a ton, driven by booming demand from AI data infrastructure and global supply concerns. The metal has surged 35% this year, essential for data centers, EVs, and clean energy due to its electrical properties. Despite rising inventories, a market deficit is projected, fueling investor interest.

title: How tight supply, AI demand propelled copper price towards $12,000
summary: Copper prices are up 35% this year, nearing $12,000 per metric ton, due to mining disruptions, US stockpiling, and soaring demand from AI data centers. Valued for its electrical conductivity, copper is vital for power grids, EVs, and energy transition infrastructure. Bullish sentiment is driven by tight supply narratives and macro news flows.

title: Copper eases after nearing USD12,000
summary: Copper prices eased after approaching $12,000 per ton, with ANZ expecting prices to remain above $11,000 in 2026 and potentially near $12,000 by year-end amid supply constraints.

title: Copper output from Codelco falls 14% in October
summary: Copper production from Chilean state-run miner Codelco fell 14.3% in October to 111,000 metric tons, according to data from copper commission Cochilco. Meanwhile, output at BHP’s Escondida mine rose 11.7% to 120,600 tons, while Collahuasi's production dropped 29.3% to 35,000 tons. The report highlights varying production trends among major Chilean copper mines.

title: Capital demands soar for new copper supply
summary: New copper projects face soaring capital demands, with 13 of 22 analyzed projects postponing start dates and increasing costs, such as Capstone Copper's Santo Domingo project which saw a 55% capex jump to add production capacity. Barrick's Reko Diq in Pakistan stands out with $9.14 billion capex for 377,000 metric tons annual copper output starting 2028. These developments reflect rising capital intensity amid expanding ore processing and infrastructure needs.

title: Chile's weekend runoff puts Codelco future at stake
summary: Chile's presidential runoff on December 14 will impact the future of state copper giant Codelco, which faces over $20 billion in debt, aging infrastructure, and production declines to a 25-year low in 2022. Legal obligations to remit profits to the government limit reinvestment, threatening Chile's mining-driven economy projected to grow 2.5% in 2025. The election outcome could balance resource nationalism with economic pragmatism for the world's top copper producer.

title: Gunnison Copper Announces That Rio Tinto's Nuton Technology ...
summary: Gunnison Copper announced Rio Tinto's Nuton technology has produced its first copper at the Johnson Camp mine in Arizona, achieving industrial-scale production in just 18 months. The technology offers superior environmental performance with up to 80% less water usage and 60% lower carbon emissions compared to traditional methods, while enabling recovery from waste materials. It aims for the lowest carbon footprint copper in the U.S. at 0.82 kg CO₂-e per kg.

title: Rio Tinto's Nuton technology produces first copper
summary: Rio Tinto's Nuton technology has successfully produced its first copper, demonstrating cleaner, faster, and more efficient production at industrial scale. It exceeds conventional methods with up to 80% less water usage and 60% lower carbon emissions, while processing primary sulphides without concentration, smelting, or refining. The technology extends mine life by valorizing waste materials.

title: Nickel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Nickel rose to 14,620 USD/T on December 12, 2025, up 0.07% from the previous day, though down 2.27% over the past month and 7.91% year-over-year. Nickel futures fell toward $14,600 per tonne amid persistent oversupply and elevated LME stockpiles exceeding 250,000 tonnes. The market faces pressure from rising inventories by around 90,000 tonnes this year.

title: Nickel Bounces after Testing 4-Year Low
summary: Nickel futures in the UK reached $14,800 per tonne, rebounding after hitting a four-year low of $14,455 on November 20th as markets reassess oversupply. The Indonesian government announced new rules granting nickel refining permits only to refiners producing specific products.

title: LME Nickel Official Prices
summary: LME Nickel cash prices were bid at 14,660 USD and offered at 14,665 USD, valid for trading on December 11 and 12, 2025. This reflects ongoing market activity near recent lows amid broader metal price pressures.

title: TECH Project high-grade nickel is primed to fuel the global green transition
summary: Queensland Pacific Metals’ TECH Project aims to become the world’s premier source of high-grade, ethically derived nickel for lithium-ion batteries in EVs and green energy. The project employs the innovative DNi Process, which recycles over 98% of nitric acid, requires no tailings dams, and produces minimal waste. Once operational, it will be a carbon-negative facility supplying key chemicals to the EV and energy storage industries.

title: Future of metal and mining: Boliden launches Low-Carbon Nickel
summary: Boliden has launched Low-Carbon Nickel with a carbon footprint of less than 5 kg CO2eq per kg nickel equivalent, far below the 2024 global average of over 34 kg. Innovations at facilities like Kevitsa and Harjavalta save over 18 million kg of CO2 emissions annually in nickel matte production. This product supports batteries for electric cars and low-carbon power generation equipment like wind turbines.

title: Green nickel for sustainable electrification: Carbon-free process extracts nickel for batteries and steel
summary: Researchers at the Max Planck Institute for Sustainable Materials have developed a carbon-free, energy-saving method using hydrogen plasma to extract nickel from low-grade ores in a single step. This process drastically reduces CO2 emissions compared to conventional methods that emit around 20 tons per ton of nickel and enables use of previously uneconomical ores. The team is now working to scale it for industrial applications to support electrification demands.

title: Nickel at a crossroads: conform or reform
summary: The global nickel market faces oversupply, shifting battery chemistries, and new demands in green hydrogen and high-temperature alloys amid slowing EV growth. Recycling firms like Redwood Materials are recovering up to 98% of nickel from end-of-life batteries, partnering with Panasonic, Toyota, and GM for a closed-loop North American supply chain. This shift emphasizes high-purity, ESG-compliant nickel production to meet policy and consumer demands.

title: Tenaris to invest in hydrogen steelmaking in Italy
summary: Tubemaker Tenaris has signed an agreement with Italian energy suppliers Edison and Snam for a project using hydrogen in steelmaking at its Dalmine seamless tube plant. The initiative focuses on studying hydrogen supply and adapting the mill for gas use to lower CO2 emissions as part of the Dalmine Zero Emissions project. Further hydrogen applications will be evaluated after initial tests.

title: Advancing power generation: Tenaris in dialogue with Macchi at Hydrogen Expo 2025
summary: Tenaris participated in a panel at Hydrogen Expo 2025 in Piacenza, Italy, discussing steel solutions for power generation with Macchi. The event highlighted Tenaris's high-performance tubular products for boilers, investments in manufacturing like its Romanian facility, and sustainable options such as Thor® 115 steel and Environmental Product Declarations.

title: Tenaris hosts panel on nuclear energy and Italy's boilermaking future
summary: Tenaris hosted a panel discussion at Fondazione Dalmine in Italy on nuclear energy's role in Europe's energy transition and Italy's boilermaking industry. Experts discussed nuclear technologies, safety advances, and Italy's manufacturing alignment with standards. Tenaris's Italian mill recently gained ASME III accreditation for nuclear materials.

title: Tenaris in Italy achieves ASME certification for the supply of materials for the nuclear sector
summary: Tenaris's Dalmine seamless steel pipe mill in Italy obtained ASME III accreditation for supplying certified materials to nuclear facilities. This certification supports global nuclear projects amid growing investments in low-carbon energy for decarbonization and energy security. It enables supply for new plants and maintenance of existing ones.
